thread.title: Youth killed over drain cleaning in Haridwar
thread.title_full: Youth killed over drain cleaning in Haridwar

author: tribuneindia.com
title: Youth killed over drain cleaning in Haridwar
text:
Tribune News Service
Haridwar, October 17
A youth was reportedly killed by his neighbour following a dispute over cleaning of a drain near their houses. Kala (30), son of Jahoor, was attacked by Deepak, a resident of Dhanpura, with a sharp knife following an altercation over water drainage. The police have arrested Deepak. Meanwhile, the situation became tense as Kala and Deepak belong to different communities and anti-social elements tried to give the incident a communal angle. SSP Krishan Raj and ADM Jeevan Singh Nangiyal reached the crime site to check the situation from aggravating. Police and Provincial Armed Constabulary personnel have been deputed in strength in the area. SP, Rural, Parmendra Dobhal said Deepak had been arrested and a case registered against him under Sections 323, 302 and 504 of the IPC. Two sisters, youth feared drowned in Ganga canal In a tragic incident, two teenage sisters and a youth were feared drowned in the Ganga canal near the Prem Nagar Ashram ghat at Ranipur in Haridwar on Saturday evening. Local people said Kamini and Kusum, daughters of Karam Veer, a resident of Tehri Vistapith Colony, had arrived on a Scooty, which they had parked at the New Haridwar Setu, adjacent to the Prem Nagar Ashram Ganga ghat. The girls reportedly slipped and fell into the canal and were swept away. The youth, who was present at the ghat, dived into the canal to save the girls but was himself swept away by the speedy current of the water. Circle Officer Chandra Mohan Singh, police personnel and Jal Police divers were working overtime to trace the bodies.
